key_points: New Jersey faces aftermath of Hurricane Ida, one of the state's deadliest storms with a death toll of 30.
Gov. Phil Murphy confirmed the death toll and noted one person from Passaic County is still missing.
Deaths occurred across several counties, with the highest numbers in Hunterdon, Somerset, and Union.
Victims include individuals from various backgrounds, professions, and ages, ranging from 30 to 70 years old.
Several victims died due to being swept away or trapped by floodwaters, and one due to electrocution while handling an electrical cord.
Two friends, Nidhi Rana and Ayush Rana, were found dead in the Passaic River after going missing during the storm.
Victims' memorials and funeral services are detailed, reflecting their lives and the impact on their communities.
President Joe Biden visited Manville, NJ, to tour Ida flood damage, where he was both greeted and jeered.
A GoFundMe for Suzie Hanna's funeral raised over $37,000, highlighting community support for victims' families.
Several victims were involved in attempts to escape the rising floodwaters before their deaths.
